refsect1.title: Signal Prototypes
refsect1.synopsis: "select-child" void user_function (GtkTree *tree, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data); "selection-changed" void user_function (GtkTree *tree, gpointer user_data); "unselect-child" void user_function (GtkTree *tree, GtkWidget *widget, gpointer user_data);

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para:
GtkTree is deprecated and unsupported. It is known to be buggy. To use it, you must define the symbol GTK_ENABLE_BROKEN prior to including the GTK+ header files. Use GtkTreeView instead.
The GtkTree widget is a container that shows users a list of items, in a tree format complete with branches and leafnodes. Branches can be expanded to show their child items, or collapsed to hide them.

warning.para: GtkTree is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: GTK_IS_ROOT_TREE()

warning.para: GTK_IS_ROOT_TREE is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: A macro that returns a boolean value which indicates if obj is a root tree or not.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkTree. obj will accept any pointer, but if the pointer does not point to a GtkTree, the results are undefined.

refsect2.title: GTK_TREE_ROOT_TREE()

warning.para: GTK_TREE_ROOT_TREE is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: A macro that returns the root tree of obj.
If obj is already a root tree, obj is cast to GtkTree and returned.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkTree. obj will accept any pointer, but if the pointer does not point to a GtkTree, the results are undefined.

warning.para: GTK_TREE_SELECTION_OLD is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: enum GtkTreeViewMode

warning.para: GtkTreeViewMode is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_new ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_new is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Creates a new GtkTree.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the newly allocated widget.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_append ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_append is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Adds the GtkTreeItem in tree_item to the end of the items in tree.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkWidget that is to be appended to the tree.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_prepend ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_prepend is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Adds the GtkTreeItem in tree_item to the start of the items in tree.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkWidget that is to be prepended to the tree.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_insert ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_insert is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Adds the GtkTreeItem in tree_item to the list of items in tree at the position indicated by position.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkWidget that is to be added to the tree.
A gint that indicates the position in the tree, that the tree_item is to be added at.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_remove_items ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_remove_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Removes a list of items from the GtkTree in tree.
If only one item is to be removed from the GtkTree, gtk_container_remove() can be used instead.
Removing an item from a GtkTree dereferences the item, and thus usually destroys the item and any subtrees it may contain. If the item is not to be destroyed, use g_object_ref() before removing it.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to a GList that contains the items to be removed.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_clear_items ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_clear_items is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Removes the items at positions between start and end from the GtkTree tree.
Removing an item from a GtkTree dereferences the item, and thus usually destroys the item and any subtrees it may contain. If the item is not to be destroyed, use g_object_ref() before removing it.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_select_item ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_select_item is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Emits the select_item signal for the child at position item, and thus selects it (unless it is unselected in a signal handler).

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_unselect_item ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_unselect_item is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Emits the unselect_item for the child at position item, and thus unselects it.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_select_child ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_select_child is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Emits the select_item signal for the child tree_item, and thus selects it (unless it is unselected in a signal handler).

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkWidget that is to be selected.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_unselect_child ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_unselect_child is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Emits the unselect_item signal for the child tree_item, and thus unselects it.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkWidget that is to be selected.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_child_position ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_child_position is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Returns the position of child in the GtkTree tree.
If child is not a child of tree, then -1 is returned.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_set_selection_mode ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_set_selection_mode is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the selection mode for the GtkTree tree.
mode can be one of

listitem.para: GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE for when only one item can be selected at a time.
GTK_SELECTION_BROWSE for when one item must be selected.
GTK_SELECTION_MULTIPLE for when many items can be selected at once.

refsect2.para: The selection mode is only defined for a root tree, as the root tree "owns" the selection.
The default mode is GTK_SELECTION_SINGLE.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_set_view_mode ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_set_view_mode is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets the 'viewmode' for the GtkTree in tree. The 'viewmode' defines how the tree looks when an item is selected.
mode can be one of:

listitem.para: GTK_TREE_VIEW_LINE : When an item is selected the entire GtkTreeItem is highlighted.
GTK_TREE_VIEW_ITEM : When an item is selected only the selected item's child widget is highlighted.

refsect2.para: The default mode is GTK_TREE_VIEW_LINE.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_set_view_lines ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_set_view_lines is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Sets whether or not the connecting lines between branches and children are drawn.

listitem.simpara: A guint, indicating TRUE, or FALSE.

refsect2.title: gtk_tree_remove_item ()

warning.para: gtk_tree_remove_item is deprecated and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Removes the item child from the GtkTree tree.

listitem.simpara: A pointer to the GtkWidget that is to be removed from the tree.

refsect2.title: The "select-child" signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted by tree whenever widget is about to be selected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
The child that is about to be selected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "selection-changed" signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted by the root tree whenever the selection changes.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "unselect-child" signal
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted by tree whenever widget is about to be unselected.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
The child that is about to be unselected.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
